title: Issue with FileZilla server (GnuTLS) and close_notify
body:

### I did this

I upload files via explicit FTPS (AUTH TLS) from a Windows client with curl 8.1.2 linked against OpenSSL 3.1.1, to a FileZilla server 1.7.2 hosted by a Windows box. 
When the data link uses Wifi or a mobile telephone network (3G/4G), I frequently encounter an issue where curl does not send the TLS alert close_notify, which triggers the wrath of GnuTLS in FileZilla server, and a FTP reply 426 ECONNABORTED. 

### I expected the following

I expected curl to send the TLS alert close_notify before closing the socket of the data channel

### curl/libcurl version
8.1.2

### solution

I have narrowed the issue  to two lines in vtls/openssl.c in ossl_close():

```C
(void)SSL_read( backend->handle, buf, sizeof buf);
(void)SSL_shutdown( backend->handle );
```

actually, SSL_shutdown() can fail. The OpenSSL documentation states that the caller should retry the call is the return value is less than zero, as long as the SSL error is SSL_ERROR_WANT_READ or SSL_ERROR_WANT WRITE. For me the following replacement code solved the issue:

```C
int res = SSL_read(  backend->handle, buf, sizeof buf);
int error = SSL_get_error(  backend->handle, res );
if (SSL_ERROR_SYSCALL != error) {
   int res = 0;
   while (res = (SSL_shutdown( backend->handle )) < 0) {
      error = SSL_get_error( backend->handle, res );
      if (error != SSL_ERROR_WANT_READ 
    && error  !SSL_ERROR_WANT ) 
        break;
   }
```
}


[curl -V output]

### operating system

WIndows for both Client and Server.

<!-- On Unix please post the output of "uname -a" -->

Best regards.
